thread.title: NASCAR Charlotte 2015: Start time, lineup, TV/radio schedule and more
thread.title_full: NASCAR Charlotte 2015: Start time, lineup, TV/radio schedule and more

author: azcentral.com
title: NASCAR Charlotte 2015: Start time, lineup, TV/radio schedule and more
text:
CONCORD, N.C. — It's NASCAR race day at Charlotte Motor Speedway, and we've got some essential information you need to get ready for Sunday's Bank of America 500.
START TIME: Kyle White, a United States Army veteran and Medal of Honor recipient, is scheduled to instruct drivers to start their engines shortly after 12:30 p.m. ET, followed by the green flag.
USA TODAY
Three Chase drivers who need a win at Charlotte Motor Speedway
RACE DISTANCE: The Bank of America 500, the second of two Sprint Cup races this season at CMS, is 334 laps around the 1.5-mile track for a total of 500 miles.
NATIONAL ANTHEM: Natalie Weiss will perform the national anthem.
TV/RADIO SCHEDULE: NBC Sports Newtork (NBCSN) will broadcast the race with a pre-race show at noon. The Performance Racing Network will call the race on the radio.
USA TODAY
Gluck: NASCAR's Chase brings thrills to fans, stress to drivers
WEATHER: The forecast calls for partly cloudy skies with race time temperatures starting in the mid 60s before increasing to the low 70s throughout the day.
LAST TIME: Kevin Harvick won last year’s Bank of America 500. Jeff Gordon was second and Jamie McMurray third. Carl Edwards won the Coca-Cola 600 at Charlotte Motor Speedway in May.
USA TODAY
Carl Edwards: 'Everything is going to have to be perfect' in next two races
STARTING LINEUP: Matt Kenseth, part of the Chase group, won the pole with a speed of 194.532 miles per hour. Following in the top five will be Kyle Busch, Joey Logano, Greg Biffle and Denny Hamlin.

2. Kyle Busch
